CARDINAL . LAW DATE sets out the procedure to be followed in bankruptcy and the powers of the trustee .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the LAW provides that the function of the trustee is to :

“ ... get in , realise and distribute the bankrupt 's estate in accordance with the following provisions of this LAW ; and in the carrying out of that function and in the management of the bankrupt 's estate the ORG is entitled , subject to those provisions , to use his own discretion . ”

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides that the bankrupt 's estate comprises all property belonging to or vested in the bankrupt at the commencement of the bankruptcy , excluding items necessary to the bankrupt for use personally by him in his employment , business or vocation or for satisfying the basic domestic needs of the bankrupt and his family .
CARDINAL . The duration of the bankruptcy is defined in section CARDINAL as beginning on DATE the bankruptcy order is made and continuing until the individual is discharged .
CARDINAL . Discharge is dealt with in section CARDINAL , which , at the relevant time , provided that :
“ ( CARDINAL ) Subject as follows , a bankrupt is discharged from bankruptcy—
( b ) ... by the expiration of the relevant period under this section .
( CARDINAL ) That period is as follows—
( b ) ... the period of DATE beginning with the commencement of the bankruptcy . ”

CARDINAL . NORP However , under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) , where the court is satisfied on the application of the official receiver that an undischarged bankrupt has failed or is failing to comply with any of his obligations , the court may order that the relevant period under section FAC ) shall cease to run for such period , or until the fulfilment of such conditions , as may be specified in the order .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL sets out the effect of a discharge and provides as follows :
“ ( l ) Subject as follows , where a bankrupt is discharged , the discharge releases him from all the bankruptcy debts , but has no effect—
( a ) on the functions ( so far as they remain to be carried out ) of the trustee of his estate , or
( b ) on the operation , for the purposes of the carrying out of those functions , of the provisions of this Part ;
and , in particular , discharge does not affect the right of any creditor of the bankrupt to prove in the bankruptcy for any debt from which the bankrupt is released .
( CARDINAL ) Discharge does not affect the right of any secured creditor of the bankrupt to enforce his security for the payment of a debt from which the bankrupt is released . ”
CARDINAL . Under sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL , at any time when there is no trustee in bankruptcy appointed , the official receiver is the receiver and manager of the bankrupt 's estate .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL makes special provision for the bankrupt 's home . It provided , at the relevant time , as follows :

“ ( l ) Where any property consisting of an interest in a bankrupt 's dwelling house which is occupied by the bankrupt or by his spouse or former spouse is comprised in the bankrupt 's estate and the ORG is , for any reason , unable for the time being to realise that property , the ORG may apply to the court for an order imposing a charge on the property for the benefit of the bankrupt 's estate .

( CARDINAL ) If on an application under this section the court imposes a charge on any property , the benefit of that charge shall be comprised in the bankrupt 's estate and is enforceable , up to the value from time to time of the property secured , for the payment of any amount which is payable otherwise than to the bankrupt out of the estate and of interest on that amount at the prescribed rate .

( CARDINAL ) An order under this section made in respect of property vested in the trustee shall provide , in accordance with the rules , for the property to cease to be comprised in the bankrupt 's estate and , subject to the charge ( and any prior charge ) , to vest in the bankrupt . ”
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act provides that :

“ Where any premises comprised in a bankrupt 's estate are occupied by him ... on condition that he makes payments towards satisfying any liability arising under a mortgage of the LOC or otherwise towards the outgoings of the LOC , the bankrupt does not , by virtue of those payments , acquire any interest in the LOC . ”
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides that :

“ ( CARDINAL ) At any time when proceedings on a bankruptcy petition are pending or an individual has been adjudged bankrupt the court may stay any action , execution or other legal process against the property or person of the debtor or , as the case may be , of the bankrupt .

( CARDINAL ) Any court in which proceedings are pending against any individual may , on proof that a bankruptcy petition has been presented in respect of that individual or that he is an undischarged bankrupt , either stay the proceedings or allow them to continue on such terms as it thinks fit .
( CARDINAL ) After the making of a bankruptcy order no person who is a creditor of the bankrupt in respect of a debt provable in the bankruptcy shall—
( a ) have any remedy against the property or person of the bankrupt in respect of that debt , or
( b ) before the discharge of the bankrupt , commence any action or other legal proceedings against the bankrupt except with the leave of the court and on such terms as the court may impose . ”
DATE . Under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) , ORG has the power , exercisable at any time , to review the order for bankruptcy , to vary it or to revoke it .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides that if a bankrupt or any of his creditors or any other person is dissatisfied by any act , omission or decision of a trustee of the bankrupt 's estate , he may apply to the court ; and on such an application the court may confirm , reverse or modify any act or decision of the trustee , may give him directions or may make such other order as it thinks fit .
CARDINAL . The Enterprise Act CARDINAL introduced changes to LAW . It entered into force on DATE .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act was amended to reduce the period of bankruptcy prior to discharge from DATE .

Section CARDINAL was also amended to limit the value of a charge on a bankrupt 's property to “ the charged value ” , which was defined as “ the amount specified in the charging order as the value of the bankrupt 's interest in the property at the date of the order plus interest on that amount from the date of the charging order at the prescribed rate ” .
CARDINAL . Finally , a new section CARDINAL was introduced into LAW and provides as follows :

“ ( CARDINAL ) This section applies where property comprised in the bankrupt 's estate consists of an interest in a dwelling - house which at the date of the bankruptcy was the sole or principal residence of—
( a ) the bankrupt ,
( b ) the bankrupt 's spouse ...
( CARDINAL ) At the end of the period of DATE beginning with the date of the bankruptcy the interest mentioned in subsection ( CARDINAL ) shall—
( a ) cease to be comprised in the bankrupt 's estate , and
( b ) vest in the bankrupt ( without conveyance , assignment or transfer ) .
( CARDINAL ) Subsection ( CARDINAL ) shall not apply if during the period mentioned in that subsection—
( a ) the ORG realises the interest mentioned in subsection ( CARDINAL ) ,
( b ) the trustee applies for an order for sale in respect of the dwelling - house ,
( c ) the trustee applies for an order for possession of the dwelling - house ,
( d ) the trustee applies for an order under LAW in LAW in respect of that interest , or

( e ) the ORG and the bankrupt agree that the bankrupt shall incur a specified liability to his estate ( with or without the addition of interest from DATE of the agreement ) in consideration of which the interest mentioned in subsection ( CARDINAL ) shall cease to form part of the estate .

( CARDINAL ) Where an application of a kind described in subsection ( CARDINAL)(b ) to ( d ) is made during the period mentioned in subsection ( CARDINAL ) and is dismissed , unless the court orders otherwise the interest to which the application relates shall on the dismissal of the application—
( a ) cease to be comprised in the bankrupt 's estate , and
( b ) vest in the bankrupt ( without conveyance , assignment or transfer ) .
( CARDINAL ) The court may substitute for DATE mentioned in subsection ( CARDINAL ) a longer period—
( a ) in prescribed circumstances , and
( b ) in such other circumstances as the court thinks appropriate . ”
